commit_message:
Fix syntax in test_load_balancer_basics._check_load_balancing

The set == {} syntax is invalid in python 2.6.

Note that even though the test is currently being skipped,
it's interpreted before the skip is executed so this fails
regardless of the skip decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1277951

Change-Id: Ic64622604a717db33555784cfe265e6af3e6dea7

commit_message:
Set uri_v3 in tempest config

This properly sets the v3 uri for keystone in the tempest config.
Previously tempest would just guess the v3 uri by replacing v2 with v3.
However, moving forward this will no longer be the case so devstack
should properly set this uri to enable tempest to use the keystone v3
api in addition to the v2.

Change-Id: Ib02b2e9f24d8ca1f381186c48747ca0fbc45f3f1

commit_message:
Modifying tests to run with different configurations

Updated datastore tests to make datastore configurable and not
assume that 'mysql' datastore will always exist.

Fixed test_create_with_bad_availability_zone. Before it was
giving a false positive. Now it is testing the right thing.

Change-Id: Ie4e81e173b73302b40e521e4a41569404203b9d2
Closes-Bug: #1276346

commit_message:
NVP plugin:fix delete sec group when backend is out of sync

If a security group does not exist on the NVP backend, an error
should not be raised on deletion of the security group.

This patch changes the plugin behavior by deleting the record
from the database and just logging that the security group
was not found on the NVP backend.

Closes-Bug: #1251422

Change-Id: Ib8adf7a830ff336655fd83ad4118cde641adf284

commit_message:
Fix a couple of unit test typos

There were two cases in rpcapi unit tests where it was checking method instead
of rpc_method.  Fix up the typo and the reason why the typo didn't matter
before.  Also fix two places where rpcapi code had a return for a cast(), which
is now caught by the unit tests.

Closes-bug: #1272518
Change-Id: Ib5e3a002f6b0f7eb8dee8bd84bd53dbf817017f7

commit_message:
WSME: update to 0.6

0.6 version adds some API parameter type classes for API validation.
We can replace each project's own classes with these WSME's classes.
By sharing the same classes between projects, it conduces to good
quality.

This commit fixes the images clients for when tenant isolation is

commit_message:
Fix images tests with tenant isolation disabled

This commit fixes the images clients for when tenant isolation is
disabled. The base image test class still had a reference to the old
auth style to get the tenant name if tenant isolation was disabled.
The recent auth_provider refactor didn't update this call so the test
would fail. This commit updates it to use the new credential dict to
get the tenant_name

Closes-Bug: #1277732

Change-Id: I42bace92e5f633d410c7a59299680caafff680f9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 20:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_s3_token_middleware.py'], 'message': "Python3: fix test_insecure

test_insecure() fails because it ends up calling guess_json_utf8() in the
requests module, where the count() method of the str type is called with bytes
input:

    nullcount = sample.count(_null)

This patch makes sure that we pass 'sample' as bytes.

Change-Id: I70071623d425ebbf910d3568a7b5c5d857892402
"}]
commit_message:
Python3: fix test_insecure

test_insecure() fails because it ends up calling guess_json_utf8() in the
requests module, where the count() method of the str type is called with bytes
input:

    nullcount = sample.count(_null)

This patch makes sure that we pass 'sample' as bytes.

Change-Id: I70071623d425ebbf910d3568a7b5c5d857892402

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-08 17:18:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objectstore/s3server.py', 'nova/tests/test_objectstore.py'], 'message': 'Add HEAD api response for test s3 server BucketHandler

Current nova test s3 server lacks HEAD for BucketHandler. And it becomes
an issue for Boto after version 2.25.0 [1], which changes underlying
implementation of get_bucket method from GET to HEAD request.

This change fixes this gap by adding HEAD response to test s3 server.
And also added cases for testing bucket existence per Boto document
suggestion[2], which applies for both Boto prior to or after version
2.25.0

[1] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/releasenotes/v2.25.0.html
[2] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/s3_tut.html#accessing-a-bucket

Change-Id: If992efa40f7f36d337d1b9b1f52859aa0ae51874
Closes-bug: #1277790
'}]
commit_message:
Add HEAD api response for test s3 server BucketHandler

Current nova test s3 server lacks HEAD for BucketHandler. And it becomes
an issue for Boto after version 2.25.0 [1], which changes underlying
implementation of get_bucket method from GET to HEAD request.

This change fixes this gap by adding HEAD response to test s3 server.
And also added cases for testing bucket existence per Boto document
suggestion[2], which applies for both Boto prior to or after version
2.25.0

[1] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/releasenotes/v2.25.0.html
[2] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/s3_tut.html#accessing-a-bucket

Change-Id: If992efa40f7f36d337d1b9b1f52859aa0ae51874
Closes-bug: #1277790

subject: boto 2.25 makes HEAD request instead of GET for retrieving bucket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-08 10:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objectstore/s3server.py'], 'message': 'boto 2.25 makes HEAD request instead of GET for retrieving bucket

Change in the latest version of boto is making a HEAD http request
to the server instead of GET to retrieve a bucket. We have not
added HEAD response in nova test s3 server and this patch addresses
the same.

Tests:
test_unknown_bucket in test_objectstore will make the get_bucket
call and http request used by boto will depend on the version. i.e.
    1. HEAD will be used by boto >= 2.25
    2. GET will be used by boto < 2.25

Change-Id: Iadcb6c98aae8eb4c6cf98d682b0a0d6313fee324
'}]
commit_message:
boto 2.25 makes HEAD request instead of GET for retrieving bucket

Change in the latest version of boto is making a HEAD http request
to the server instead of GET to retrieve a bucket. We have not
added HEAD response in nova test s3 server and this patch addresses
the same.

Tests:
test_unknown_bucket in test_objectstore will make the get_bucket
call and http request used by boto will depend on the version. i.e.
    1. HEAD will be used by boto >= 2.25
    2. GET will be used by boto < 2.25

Change-Id: Iadcb6c98aae8eb4c6cf98d682b0a0d6313fee324

commit_message:
Move v3_to_v2_user from manager to controller

Managers should have no knowledge of v2 or v3, only the controllers
should, so this moves the v3_to_v2_user function from the identity
manager to common.controller.V2Controller.

Change-Id: I0c111245965a2578cfe1d7c9f1ca2df2f612b0d9

subject: Fix rally benchmark's timeout mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-08 18:15:54.000000000', 'files': ['etc/rally/rally.conf.sample', 'tests/test_osclients.py', 'rally/osclients.py'], 'message': "Fix rally benchmark's timeout mechanism

Under big load OpenStack cloud sometimes stops
responding and python clients start waiting forever,
as they are using httplib multiprocessing.Pool is not able to
kill thread with this request => benchmark is never ended..

To resolve this we should set for all opentstack python clients
timeout.

We chose for default value 30 seconds, but it could be setted
via rally.conf.

Change-Id: Ideb45c91c4e3130d11e7afb6e912af699eee91e2
Closes-Bug: #1277855
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rally benchmark's timeout mechanism

Under big load OpenStack cloud sometimes stops
responding and python clients start waiting forever,
as they are using httplib multiprocessing.Pool is not able to
kill thread with this request => benchmark is never ended..

To resolve this we should set for all opentstack python clients
timeout.

We chose for default value 30 seconds, but it could be setted
via rally.conf.

Change-Id: Ideb45c91c4e3130d11e7afb6e912af699eee91e2
Closes-Bug: #1277855

commit_message:
Use --block-device to boot from volume

The nova boot --block_device_mapping option is deprecated and will
disappear. Use the new --block-device option to boot an instance from a
volume.

Also add a bit more detail about the --swap and --ephemeral options.

Closes-Bug: #1269768
Change-Id: I746b77572514663e13bba53ff9d7f126a667c2dc

commit_message:
Fix assignment to not require user or group existence

The assignment code was requiring the existence of users and
groups before performing different operations. With federation,
the users and groups may legitimately not be defined in keystone,
so these checks cannot be done.

Implements: bp no-check-id
Change-Id: Ib9d0188ae2a436617bad90bf936e7b3dbf296885

subject: Assignment returns fake user for unknown users
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-31 14:24:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_controller_v2.py'], 'message': 'Assignment returns fake user for unknown users

If a client attempts to list the users for a project and a user
is not known to the identity manager then the Keystone server will
return a fake user entry to represent the user.

The user may not be known to the identity backend due to the use
of federation.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: Ib2de0b03152cf10a0ae204a95db20dcc4e552d6e
'}]
commit_message:
Assignment returns fake user for unknown users

If a client attempts to list the users for a project and a user
is not known to the identity manager then the Keystone server will
return a fake user entry to represent the user.

The user may not be known to the identity backend due to the use
of federation.

bp no-check-id

Change-Id: Ib2de0b03152cf10a0ae204a95db20dcc4e552d6e

commit_message:
Switch to testrepository for running tests

OpenStack as a whole is moving towards using testrepository and
testtools for running tests. To that end, bring Glance into line by
switching it to use testrepository to run tests.

This copies run_tests.sh and tools/colorizer.py from Nova.

This change also has some minor changes to make run_test.sh work well.

Partial fixes bug: 1179009
Fixes bug: 1271806

Change-Id: Ic265bc0d2f1528358f6e8ee5b4139f991923fc72
Signed-off-by: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Fix broken objectstore test due to boto v2.25 get_bucket change
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-08 13:32:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_objectstore.py'], 'message': "Fix broken objectstore test due to boto v2.25 get_bucket change

Since boto v2.25.0, there's a underlying change for get_bucket method
from GET to HEAD[1]. As a side effect, there's no more S3ResponseError
exception returned which casued the original test_unknown_bucket broken.

This change treats Boto prior to version v2.25.0 and after in separate
cases to address this issue while keeping backward compatible.

[1] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/releasenotes/v2.25.0.html

Change-Id: I6598d9cabd1c5bc357ae20bcd954ccf8a6e12d74
Closes-bug: #1277790
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken objectstore test due to boto v2.25 get_bucket change

Since boto v2.25.0, there's a underlying change for get_bucket method
from GET to HEAD[1]. As a side effect, there's no more S3ResponseError
exception returned which casued the original test_unknown_bucket broken.

This change treats Boto prior to version v2.25.0 and after in separate
cases to address this issue while keeping backward compatible.

[1] http://docs.pythonboto.org/en/latest/releasenotes/v2.25.0.html

Change-Id: I6598d9cabd1c5bc357ae20bcd954ccf8a6e12d74
Closes-bug: #1277790

The solution to bug 1272500 (Unit tests failing with sqllite 3.8.2-1)
is to use a newer version of db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator.
This sync introduces a few incompatible changes that also had to
be fixed for the unit tests to pass:

-_extra_keys in Models must be a property
-Additional utcnow calls were added, which broke some unit tests
that were incorrectly mocking timeutils.utcnow.  timeutils
provides an override method that allows fake times to be returned
in unit tests.

Change-Id: I99685c8a1086fa4e1354f1fa0a715d88d0468dc6
Closes-Bug: #1272500
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Sync latest db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator

The solution to bug 1272500 (Unit tests failing with sqllite 3.8.2-1)
is to use a newer version of db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator.
This sync introduces a few incompatible changes that also had to
be fixed for the unit tests to pass:

-_extra_keys in Models must be a property
-Additional utcnow calls were added, which broke some unit tests
that were incorrectly mocking timeutils.utcnow.  timeutils
provides an override method that allows fake times to be returned
in unit tests.

Change-Id: I99685c8a1086fa4e1354f1fa0a715d88d0468dc6
Closes-Bug: #1272500
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

commit_message:

to false if Neutron was enabled. Recent changes to both neutron and tempest
should make this safe finally.

commit_message:
remove database init from horizon

horizon default config no longer uses a session database, it uses
signed cookies instead, so we can stop doing db initialization and
cleanup (which based on errexit we weren't doing correctly anyway).

Change-Id: Icae4318e2784486db2888cbf353e95ac9a5d7cba

commit_message:
Don't initalise deployment engine when starting a task

In some cases initialsing the deployment engine can lead to
authentication against external services - eg openstack server provider.
This is unnecessary when the deployment is already complete.

Change-Id: Ibe06a6acf8396023059292a9e5804616ed28e766
Closes-Bug: #1277342

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-07 15:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['rally/serverprovider/providers/openstack.py', 'tests/serverprovider/providers/test_openstack.py'], 'message': "Don't require glance to use OpenStack server provider

Currently the openstack server provider fails if glance is not present
in the service catalog, even if the user only wishes to use pre-existing
images.

This is a problem when using certain *cough* cloud providers that don't
expose glance.

Change-Id: Ib91be7e9396190045d82c3f0a059c92a73374499
Closes-Bug: #1277150
"}]
commit_message:
Don't require glance to use OpenStack server provider

Currently the openstack server provider fails if glance is not present
in the service catalog, even if the user only wishes to use pre-existing
images.

This is a problem when using certain *cough* cloud providers that don't
expose glance.

Change-Id: Ib91be7e9396190045d82c3f0a059c92a73374499
Closes-Bug: #1277150

commit_message:
Replace mongo shell interaction with script

In the section of 'Install the Telemetry service', we need to create
the database and a ceilometer database user. Currently we use mongo
shell and require user to interact with it. However, we can use
mongo script and do it via single copy and paste.

commit_message:
Enable py33 unit test

Python 3.3 unit test cannot be run because renamed modules and
attributes compatibility problem, this patch uses six module to
enable python 3.3 unit test. All failures can be fixed in next
patches.

Change-Id: I346997d295b0e5cae6fe9beda21573cebed3d44a

`self.assertRaises(Exception)` is not allowed per H202. But in certain

Change-Id: If4bc560edf2cbc982b45b32be20aebced3e4a586
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to have noqa on H202

`self.assertRaises(Exception)` is not allowed per H202. But in certain
contexts, there can be a lot of different exception that can be raised
without that being a problem (KeyError, ValueErrorâ¦) nor a bug, so
having the ability to noqa it is useful.

Change-Id: If4bc560edf2cbc982b45b32be20aebced3e4a586

subject: tempest concurrency 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 14:17:56.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'tempest concurrency 3

Tempest was used with concurrency 4 for a long time,
at the end of havana cycle concurrency 8 was considered to use,
but it just decreased the job time by several minute.

After the concurrency decreased from 4 to 2 the jobs run time increased
5-15 minute.

Setting the concurrency to 3 in order to decrease the run time, but
do not give as stress to the vms as with 4.

Change-Id: I07c96b89c3fed788012c801f8c538b3f8741b6c4
'}]
commit_message:
tempest concurrency 3

Tempest was used with concurrency 4 for a long time,
at the end of havana cycle concurrency 8 was considered to use,
but it just decreased the job time by several minute.

After the concurrency decreased from 4 to 2 the jobs run time increased
5-15 minute.

Setting the concurrency to 3 in order to decrease the run time, but
do not give as stress to the vms as with 4.

Change-Id: I07c96b89c3fed788012c801f8c538b3f8741b6c4

subject: Celery plugging
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-31 16:15:31.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/nose_plugin/nose_storage_plugin.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/storage/engine.py', 'fuel_plugin/bin/adapter_api.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/nose_plugin/nose_adapter.py', 'setup.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/mixins.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/storage/models.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/celery_app/celeryconfig.py', 'fabfile.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/celery_app/__init__.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/wsgi/controllers.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/celery_app/ostf_celery_app.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/cli_config.py'], 'message': "Celery plugging

Celery application were included to project. Code that launches workers
in separate subprocess when server is started was added. Workers are
terminated by server shutdown.

Celeryconfig file was created with all needed settings params for celery.

In ostf_celery_app.py script celery task definition which describes test
run execution was added and cleaning_up. These tasks are now assynchoniously
called via NoseAdapter's methods. WSGI-controllers and models script
were modified to provide proper starting of tests execution.

To make row execution of dependent test runs chain pattern from celery
is using now. Also maxtasksperchild param was added to workers setup command
in order to remove issue with dependent test runs data.

Working code for kill action was added. Now when test runs are started in run
method of NoseAdapter task_registry dict stores binding between celery
task and test_run being executed by this task. This bindind
is used then in kill method for task termination and db data updating.

Change-Id: I5e614b2b2df102be432c18a9a0350bb11d7d98aa
"}]
commit_message:
Celery plugging

Celery application were included to project. Code that launches workers
in separate subprocess when server is started was added. Workers are
terminated by server shutdown.

Celeryconfig file was created with all needed settings params for celery.

In ostf_celery_app.py script celery task definition which describes test
run execution was added and cleaning_up. These tasks are now assynchoniously
called via NoseAdapter's methods. WSGI-controllers and models script
were modified to provide proper starting of tests execution.

To make row execution of dependent test runs chain pattern from celery
is using now. Also maxtasksperchild param was added to workers setup command
in order to remove issue with dependent test runs data.

Working code for kill action was added. Now when test runs are started in run
method of NoseAdapter task_registry dict stores binding between celery
task and test_run being executed by this task. This bindind
is used then in kill method for task termination and db data updating.

Change-Id: I5e614b2b2df102be432c18a9a0350bb11d7d98aa

commit_message:
All API controllers inherit from wsgi.Controller

Most of the Nova Public API Controllers inherit from wsgi.Controller, but
still some Nova Public APIs controllers directly inherit from object. So
it's necessary to unify all the Nova Public API Controllers inherit from
wsgi.Controller.

Change-Id: Ib332fb7b1051589f38463af4959383c606017637
Closes-Bug: #1262480

subject: Improve staticweb work with transformed URLs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-11-05 11:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_domain_remap.py', 'swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_cname_lookup.py', 'swift/common/middleware/domain_remap.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_staticweb.py', 'swift/common/middleware/cname_lookup.py'], 'message': "Improve staticweb work with transformed URLs

Staticweb redirections not worked properly if requested URL
was transformed by cname_lookup and domain_remap middlewares.
Location of redirection didn't preserve requested domain
(replaced by storage_domain) and wasn't properly handle by staticweb.

Add some enviromental variables that make staticweb aware
about other middlewares actions. Domain_remap join trailing slash
in path when staticweb required it.

Change-Id: If53d41feb1f01505f68b72114b4abbf2ac4c3673
Fixes: bug #1190625
"}]
commit_message:
Improve staticweb work with transformed URLs

Staticweb redirections not worked properly if requested URL
was transformed by cname_lookup and domain_remap middlewares.
Location of redirection didn't preserve requested domain
(replaced by storage_domain) and wasn't properly handle by staticweb.

Add some enviromental variables that make staticweb aware
about other middlewares actions. Domain_remap join trailing slash
in path when staticweb required it.

Change-Id: If53d41feb1f01505f68b72114b4abbf2ac4c3673
Fixes: bug #1190625

commit_message:
validate if the router has external gateway interface set

If the router wants to work with vpn service, we must
make sure external gateway interface is set.

This patch cannot prevent user from clearing the gateway interface
of the router after the vpnservice is created.

Change-Id: If0f00def949b31c1e3da7a2cd055454567201e4c
Closes-Bug: #1258379

subject: Remove host from per notification options
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 9954, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'username': 'lbragstad', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 02:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_notifications.py', 'keystone/notifications.py'], 'message': "Remove host from per notification options

Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.%(host)s' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per keystone instance than modify when actually emitting
a notification.

It is also incompatible with the way oslo.messaging expects to be called
where you setup a publisher_id once at startup and then all future
messages will reuse this value.

As there is nothing so far using this parameter remove it.

Change-Id: Ie70c313bcebd67cc8c6a3d25eba95405089bd44a
blueprint: oslo-messaging
"}]
commit_message:
Remove host from per notification options

Specifying host allows you to set the sender so that messages come from
'identity.%(host)s' however this is something you are far more likely to
want to set up per keystone instance than modify when actually emitting
a notification.

It is also incompatible with the way oslo.messaging expects to be called
where you setup a publisher_id once at startup and then all future
messages will reuse this value.

As there is nothing so far using this parameter remove it.

Change-Id: Ie70c313bcebd67cc8c6a3d25eba95405089bd44a
blueprint: oslo-messaging

commit_message:
New Event uuid column and autoincremental id

Re added the autoincremental id column for the Event table, and added a
new column to store the event uuid. The uuid will be exposed to the user
as the id of the event, but internally the event will be handled using
the value of the id column.

Change-Id: I43464c6079bf7631fda0c4ab112b8f874c6190a3
Co-Authored-By: chmouel@enovance.com
Closes-Bug: #1261883

commit_message:
RBD unit test improvements

This commit brings the implementation of the test_rbd and
test_backup_ceph unit tests more inline and tries to ensure
that no mock is set without being unset so as not to tread
on the toes of any other tests.

Change-Id: Ibb6bd3bf90952914512e3fa39fd216f43f0f8ecb
Closes-bug: 1276657

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-07 10:18:35.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add a new dependency: trollius

Trollius is a port of the new asyncio module on Python 2.6 and 2.7. I would
like to replace eventlet with asyncio (Trollius). See my blueprint for Oslo
Messaging for more information:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/asyncio

Limit the version to < 0.2 because the API *might* be broken in version 0.2.

Change-Id: Ic5d1df60eb3b86696f4c61d609e617c2ed05518c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new dependency: trollius

Trollius is a port of the new asyncio module on Python 2.6 and 2.7. I would
like to replace eventlet with asyncio (Trollius). See my blueprint for Oslo
Messaging for more information:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/blueprints/asyncio

Limit the version to < 0.2 because the API *might* be broken in version 0.2.

Change-Id: Ic5d1df60eb3b86696f4c61d609e617c2ed05518c

commit_message:
Ignore outdated messages sent to conductor

Adds a sent_at field to conductor messages in the manager so that
messages that get out of sync on their way to conductor don't cause
trouble by updating instances or backups with out-of-date information.

Implements: blueprint conductor-ignore-old-messages
Change-Id: If06d2f9c9f993100be66f71274240a59b05b66e3

commit_message:
Adds RDP console support

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-rdp-console

Nova currently supports VNC and SPICE remote console protocols. This
commit adds support for the RDP protocol in a similar way.

Change-Id: I2c219d4a200122c6d6cfcbd8e074dca0f6fea598

clearly. This patch adds the keyword to some test classes which do
not contain it.

- added a copyright header
- applied the same order of titles/headers used in other docs (typically
  === underline+overline for top level, === underline for second level,
  --- underline for third level, ~~~ underline for fourth level, etc)

commit_message:
cleaned up extension development docs

- added a copyright header
- applied the same order of titles/headers used in other docs (typically
  === underline+overline for top level, === underline for second level,
  --- underline for third level, ~~~ underline for fourth level, etc)
- used ``double backticks`` around literals
- removed excessive whitespace
- replaced a plaintext link with an embedded link

Change-Id: Ic2bf8ed65433c82d0bdfb8dc2d8a18a0b62d6c30

subject: Change import of exceptions for keystoneclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 10:51:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Change import of exceptions for keystoneclient

Keystoneclients uses module `keystoneclient.exceptions` for storing
exceptions, so it needed to import `keystoneclient.exceptions`
instead of `keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions` in tempest.

Change-Id: I68cb50bd092e9cc304710bf7748a1c0de5554612
Closes-Bug: #1276093
'}]
commit_message:
Change import of exceptions for keystoneclient

Keystoneclients uses module `keystoneclient.exceptions` for storing
exceptions, so it needed to import `keystoneclient.exceptions`
instead of `keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions` in tempest.

Change-Id: I68cb50bd092e9cc304710bf7748a1c0de5554612
Closes-Bug: #1276093

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-07 19:16:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'HOT templates get_param allows extra attributes

HOT templates now allow the use of extra attributes for the
get_param function. With this change it is possible to traverse complex
parameters.

If one of the extra arguments does not match with a key or a valid
index, an empty string is returned.

Change-Id: I49f46b164fd21f6cc7dcea8d4ec1046f6cc912b3
Implements: blueprint hot-select
'}]
commit_message:
HOT templates get_param allows extra attributes

HOT templates now allow the use of extra attributes for the
get_param function. With this change it is possible to traverse complex
parameters.

If one of the extra arguments does not match with a key or a valid
index, an empty string is returned.

Change-Id: I49f46b164fd21f6cc7dcea8d4ec1046f6cc912b3
Implements: blueprint hot-select

commit_message:
Make test mysql connection code less confusing

There are two similar methods used for connecting to MySQL apps, but
their arguments differed in order which made for some confusion. This
makes their argument signatures identical.

Change-Id: I48818e2eadb81944e7369e12d09af9c3394d6b57

A common scenario in shared clouds will be that a cloud provider will

their chosen identity provider. In the base case, this might well be

want smaller customers to have their identity managed solely
within the OpenStack cloud, perhaps in a shared SQL database.

(namely user and groups), which are specified by creation of a domain
configuration file for each domain that requires its own backend.

allowing, for example, the removal of domain validation from the

commit_message:
Implement domain specific Identity backends

A common scenario in shared clouds will be that a cloud provider will
want to be able to offer larger customers the ability to interface to
their chosen identity provider. In the base case, this might well be
their own corporate LDAP/AD directory.  A cloud provider might also
want smaller customers to have their identity managed solely
within the OpenStack cloud, perhaps in a shared SQL database.

This patch allows domain specific backends for identity objects
(namely user and groups), which are specified by creation of a domain
configuration file for each domain that requires its own backend.

A side benefit of this change is that it clearly separates the
backends into those that are domain-aware and those that are not,
allowing, for example, the removal of domain validation from the
LDAP identity backend.

Implements bp multiple-ldap-servers

DocImpact

Change-Id: I489e8e50035f88eca4235908ae8b1a532645daab

Many pieces of data, such as user session information, will need to be
accessed from many modules within Solum.  Tenant/project ID is a good example
of some typical data that may reside in this class.  This class is meant to
be the centralized data repository.  Nova was used as a starting point:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/context.pyw

* Added key searches in get(), get_pub() and get_priv() functions

Change-Id: I6a10e3cad26a88f83000d1d3b03b99ba014e3dcb
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Centralized context class for holding "global" data

Many pieces of data, such as user session information, will need to be
accessed from many modules within Solum.  Tenant/project ID is a good example
of some typical data that may reside in this class.  This class is meant to
be the centralized data repository.  Nova was used as a starting point:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/context.pyw

* Added key searches in get(), get_pub() and get_priv() functions

Change-Id: I6a10e3cad26a88f83000d1d3b03b99ba014e3dcb

commit_message:
Add devtest support for power management

Updates the devtest scripts (for seed and undercloud) to
support real power management commands.

This moves us closer to parity with the old TOCI scripts
which support provisioning real hardware.

Change-Id: I5939134a79ecf825380c716c0411d00e90e22deb
